result.execSummary:
The defendant Joshua James Hightower was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

supervisions.notes: Probation Review Hearing scheduled for January 8, 2016 at 01:15pm.

miscConds.notes:
Pay all MANDATORY costs, assessments, surcharges, victim/witness surcharge, domestic violence surcharge, and supervision fees as determined by Dept of Corrections.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means. ANY CASH BAIL ON DEPOSIT TO BE APPLIED.
Provide DNA sample, pay costs and DNA surcharge.

NO VIOLENT CONTACT with the victim rising to the level of probable cause for arrest for "domestic abuse or harassment".
NO NEW LAW VIOLATIONS.

Attend and successfully complete Anger Management and continued programming.
Parenting classes.

AODA and recommended treatment including random urine screens/Maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Attend and successfully complete treatment and counseling programs as deemed appropriate by agent.

timeConds.notes: STAYED pending a review on 1-8-2016 at 1:15 pm in Branch 38.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joshua James Hightower

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Defendant Joshua James Hightower in court.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Defendant is compliant or mostly compliant with probation.  The remaining condition time is stayed.  Court found that further review is not needed.

Defendant Joshua James Hightower in court with attorney J. Dennis Thornton.  Patrick D. Winter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by parties and the defendant.
The court sentenced the defendant to serve 60 days in the House of Correction,  with credit for 3 days time served. 
The court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on probation with the WI Department of Corrections for a period of 12 months.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-Serve 20 days in the House of Correction STAYED pending a review on 1-8-2016 at 1:15pm in Branch 38.
-Attend and successfully complete Anger Management and continued programming.
-AODA and recommended treatment including random urine screens/Maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
-Parenting classes.
-Attend and successfully complete treatment and counseling programs as deemed appropriate by agent.
-NO VIOLENT CONTACT with the victim rising to the level of probable cause for arrest for "domestic abuse or harassment".
-Obtain/maintain employment.
-No contact with firearms.
-NO NEW LAW VIOLATIONS.
-Pay all MANDATORY costs, assessments, surcharges, victim/witness surcharge, domestic violence surcharge, and supervision fees as determined by Dept of Corrections.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means. ANY CASH BAIL ON DEPOSIT TO BE APPLIED.
-Provide DNA sample, pay costs and DNA surcharge.
-48 USC Section 922(g)(9) prohibits possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a misdemeanor crime of domestic violence.
RECEIVED & FILED: Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief; Pretrial Incarceration Credit; Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for January 8, 2016 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant Joshua James Hightower in court with attorney J. Dennis Thornton.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
BRANCH 26 FOR BRANCH 38.
Matter set for jury trial today but has resolved.  
AS to count 1, court orders count dismissed and read in for sentencing.
AS to count 2:    Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, and further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. Defendant examined as to plea, and entered a plea of guilty.  Court found defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived all constitutional rights. Plea questionnaire waiver of rights and addendum to plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulated to the criminal complaint as factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered into the record.  
State is requesting an adjournment of sentencing for victim notification.
Case adjourned to 10-1-2015 at 8:15.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 1, 2015 at 08:15 am.
State's Witness List received and filed.

Defendant Joshua James Hightower in court with attorney J. Dennis Thornton.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  All parties notified as of August 3, 2015  this case is assigned to Judge Jeffrey Wagner,  Branch 38, in Room 502 of the Courthouse.  Jury trial scheduled for September 14, 2015 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Joshua James Hightower in court with attorney J. Dennis Thornton.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Pretrial Conference held off the record.  Discovery and offer received by defense counsel.  Case adjourned for Final Pretrial Conference in Branch 4 on 5-27-2015 at 1:30 pm.  mld

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Tanisha G.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Joshua James Hightower in court with attorney James Edgar Toran.  Sara Nicole Volden Schroeder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Flanagan, Branch 04.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.   Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Defendant IS Public Defender eligible.  Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  The case is adjourned to Br. 04 for a Pretrial Conference.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 5, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 4/23/15 @ 1:30 pm
